snippet: As revealed in a new memoir, “Not My Father’s Son,” Mr. Cumming lived for years under the long shadow of his father — or, at least, the man he thought was his father.
abstract: Actor Alan Cumming's new memoir Not My Father's Son discusses how Cumming lived for years under the long shadow of his father, or, at least, the man he thought was his father; Cumming says retracing his troubled childhood while writing the book helped him discover why he became a performer in the first place.
lead_paragraph: As revealed in a new memoir, “Not My Father’s Son,” Mr. Cumming lived for years under the long shadow of his father — or, at least, the man he thought was his father.

headline.main: For Alan Cumming, Life Isn’t Always a Cabaret

keywords.value: Who Do You Think You Are? (Movie)
keywords.name: creative_works
